remarks: A version of ~ climadd using bound-variable hypotheses instead of distinct variable conditions.  (Contributed by Glauco Siliprandi, 11-Dec-2019.)
statement:
climaddf.1 $e |- F/ k ph $.
climaddf.2 $e |- F/_ k F $.
climaddf.3 $e |- F/_ k G $.
climaddf.4 $e |- F/_ k H $.
climaddf.5 $e |- Z = ( ZZ>= ` M ) $.
climaddf.6 $e |- ( ph -> M e. ZZ ) $.
climaddf.7 $e |- ( ph -> F ~~> A ) $.
climaddf.8 $e |- ( ph -> H e. X ) $.
climaddf.9 $e |- ( ph -> G ~~> B ) $.
climaddf.10 $e |- ( ( ph /\ k e. Z ) -> ( F ` k ) e. CC ) $.
climaddf.11 $e |- ( ( ph /\ k e. Z ) -> ( G ` k ) e. CC ) $.
climaddf.12 $e |- ( ( ph /\ k e. Z ) -> ( H ` k ) = ( ( F ` k ) + ( G ` k ) ) ) $.
climaddf $p |- ( ph -> H ~~> ( A + B ) ) $.
$d Z k $.
